alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:24AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations generally less than one inch, with local amounts in excess of 6 inches possible over extreme northern and southern portions of Platte County. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Platte County in southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. The worst conditions are expected through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and poor visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
